climbs.name: Toys in the Attic
climbs.fa: Scott McDaniel, Matt Starr, Manny Rangel

content.description: Getting past the hueco/roof about 2/3 way up was cruxy. Finishing was fun too. Look right on the ledge for anchors.
content.protection: Single .3 to #4; double #2 to #3; stoppers and a Titon
content.location: A little more than halfway down the wall, into an alcove just past Nothing but No's, is a hand crack in a dihedral. Work up the crack until you gain a big hole and surmount the crack at the top of it. Easier climbing to the top.

content.description: Starts in corner with wide crack, lots of features. Up 20 feet to ledge, then continue straight up on hands, fingers, and face holds.
content.protection: doubles BD 0.3 through 1, single 2, nuts. No top anchor. Descend by scrambling climbers left around back to below cliff.
content.location: toward center of wall, wide looking corner to crack. Doesn't climb like a wide crack.

climbs.name: Master of the Flying Guillotine
climbs.fa: Scott McDaniel, Matt Starr, Manny Rangel

content.description: After Scott lead it we cleaned it. Great job! It's a long crack with a wide beginning that tapers to a final thin nut placement.
content.protection: Single .3 to #4s; double #1 to #3; stoppers and if you dare, a titon!
content.location: The wall descends towards the creek, and this is around the first corner, facing south. It is the tallest unbroken crack on the wall.

content.description: Very solid thin edges and pinches with slick feet make a fun combination. Soon to be bolted
content.location: Furthest right portion of the wall. Scramble up to the main ledge. Scramble to the top from left side of the wall and carefully clip the anchor

content.description: This buttress sticks out in the lower middle half of the wall. The difficulty of leading a hard start can be minimized by stick-clipping the 2nd bolt. The 3rd bolt is easier to clip from a hold above the bolt.
content.location: Head downhill to lower half and look for a steep start on a buttress with a thin seam/crack .

content.description: South facing cliff with shorter routes around 50  to 75 feet. Sunny most of the day. When you get on top of a route, face south, draw a deep breath, and give a yodel.
